page.title: 13OYSTER FARMING, WEST MERSEA.
page.content: One of the small but very important industries on Mersea is concerned with cultivating oysters. The oysters are cultivated down in pools on the Hard. The Hard is where all the boats are kept.There is lots of mud at the Hard.The oyster beds are like big rectangles.The oysters are taken into a hut.If the oysters are too small they are put into a bucket so that the next time the men go out they can take the oysters and put them back into the sea.The oysters that they keep are sent to restaurants and cafes to be eaten.The bigger oysters get more barnacles,the smaller oysters do not get as many.An oyster is a shellfish.You can buy oysters on Mersea at a hut in Coast Road.
